Submenus.Title: Introduction
Submenus.Contents:
Welcome, dear user; to the terminal-based interactive menu.
The menu contains:
- A file navigator
- An RSS reader
- And even a HTTP GET request.
Please enjoy your stay!

Submenus.Title: Editing the menu
Submenus.Contents:
This menu is completely editable.
By accessing the Menu.json file, you can add or remove menu items.
The menu uses five basic fields that you can read more about:

Submenus.Title: Title
Submenus.Contents:
The Title field holds the title of the submenu.
The title is what's used to represent the submenus when they're listed.
`The title also appears at the top of each menu when you enter it.

Submenus.Title: Contents
Submenus.Contents:
The Contents field is mostly optional.
It contains the descriptive text of the selected menu.
More often than not, this can be omitted entirely.
Use this for user-info.

Submenus.Title: Submenus
Submenus.Contents:
The Submenus field is just a list of menu items.
Each element follows the same structure as a standard menu item.
The submenus can be nested indefinitely.

Submenus.Title: Source
Submenus.Contents:
The Source field contains an external data source.
This external source can be an URL, or a file path.
The Source field does nothing when used with a Text menu.

Submenus.Title: SourceType
Submenus.Contents:
The SourceType field tells the menu how to deserialise the menu item.
The source types are as follows:

Submenus.Title: Text
Submenus.Contents:
Text sources are the most simple.
They rely solely on what's given to them through the source file

Submenus.Title: File
Submenus.Contents: File sources use a file path as their source, and display its info.

Submenus.Title: Folder
Submenus.Contents:
Folder sources use a file path as their source
The path is used to display the containing files and folders

Submenus.Title: Rss
Submenus.Contents:
The RSS sources take a URL to an RSS page and runs it through a simple parser.
The parsed data is then displayed on-screen.

Submenus.Title: RestGet
Submenus.Contents: The rest-get sends a GET to the specified source URL.
